body.p: Recall the example concerning the delivery of an important document. To maximize the chances of on-time delivery, two copies of the document are sent using two services, service A and service B. It is known that the probabilities of on-time delivery are:
0.75 for both services being on time: P(A and B) = 0.75
What is the probability that only service B delivers the document on time?

response.feedback: Incorrect. P(B) is different from P(only B) because P(B) includes the situation in which both services deliver the document on time. (A delivers it on time and B delivers it on time).
Incorrect. P(not A) includes situations in which service B delivers the document on time and situations in which service B does not deliver the document on time.
Correct. If only service B delivers on time, then B and "not A" both occur.
Incorrect. We want the probability that only service B delivers on time which means service A does not deliver on time.
